Reviews.Title: “Great location; quiet neighbourhood; very clean room”
Reviews.Author: Beverly008
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking, we had no idea what the room would look like - the room assignment depends upon what is available on the day you arrive. Each unit is decorated differently. When booking, you may identify your preferences (eg "quiet room at the back) but the hotel clearly advises they cannot provide a guarantee. The unit we were assigned had just undergone a total renovation, and we were told that we were the first guests to occupy it. It was standard size for Manhatten: a well-organized bed/sitting room with kitchen facility at one end. The decor was very modern, as were the superb spa-like bathroom and kitchen. Our unit was ultra-clean. The units next to us were under renovation during our 5 night stay, but the hammering did not begin until after 9 am and ended by 5 pm. There was no disruption to us - we were out all day, enjoying everything NYC has to offer. It was unusually hot and humid in NYC at the end of September; the A/C was functioning very well. All in all a very comfortable room and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms & close to shops but not good for restaurants”
Reviews.Author: 2papillions
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed over 3 separate occasions for total of 11 nights. Rooms were big on all stays. Once had separate living room but small closet. The others we had no living room but 2 closets. Poor breakfast, dont even think about it, buy outside. Reception provided basic service. Generally great location with easy access to most attractions via trains. But not so convenient for good restaurants for dinnner or night life, you'd expect to travel 20-30min to go anyway decent. I'll stay again if I'm going there to shop, otherwise I'll try Soho/Tribeca area next time, as more vibrant.

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs an update and under delivers in value”
Reviews.Author: ctcristo
Reviews.Content: I had a suite in the Lombardy and I would say it's overrated for the price. The suite is large, but badly needs an update. There is a library in the living room with musty old books no one has touched in years. The living room TV is no more than 19 inches. If you want to watch sports in the living room, you'd have to squint really hard to make out anything; sofa and chairs are probably a relic from the '90s. Very spacious, but I would have traded that for a smaller but more comfortable and warm room. For $350+ a night, you can do better! Also, it has only 2 elevators, and one of them has an attendant. So I guess if you prefer full service in your elevator ride, this is good--however, if you don't, then you have one working elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The Lombardy is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NadineTheQueen
Reviews.Content: It is my understanding from speaking with the staff that this was once a fine residential hotel. Now it is mostly a co-op hotel where “shareholders” own the individual rooms and decorate them to their liking. They all come with a little kitchenette complete with small frig, microwave, coffee maker and hair blow dryer. The hotel supplies the sheets, towels, toiletries and housekeeping. I had never heard of this place before booking four rooms here for a family get together. Each room was very unique in their own way and one was more beautiful than the next. I found the rooms to be very large, very clean, very comfortable and quiet. I love that they double sheet the beds – a big thing for me with hotels. It is in a great mid-town location. I highly recommend it and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and peasant little room”
Reviews.Author: DOCOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Lombardy because the rate was really good and the location too. I usually stay at Marriott hotels, but wanted to give somewhere else a try. The Lombardy is quite old and the general impression is that of another era for sure. the ground floor is under renovations and there is not much space available for use now, but my room was very nice. The staff are very helpful and, overall, the experience was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: eeeema
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in early March 2011. Everything about the hotel was outstanding. The service, location, room and amenities were excellent and the price we paid was a great deal. We booked through IPrefer and could not believe the rate. The room had everything we needed - kitchenette, dining table, comfortable bed, great cleaning staff. On a rainy day umbrellas were loaned to us; we also used the lobby business area for printing boarding passes, at no charge. In-room included internet always worked well. Front desk staff was always courteous and helpful. Doormen were great sources of local information. Would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend to everyone we know traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LeafsNation
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lombardy in late November 2011 - rooms were very clean and wonderfully appointed. Central location close to the subway and Bloomingdales. Breakfast was included, which was great as we were travelling with two teenaged boys with big appetites (expensive to feed in NYC!). Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Home, sweet home”
Reviews.Author: TheAccidentalTripper
Reviews.Content: LombardyÂ´s location is spetacular, close to the best NY has to offer. Hotel management (thanks, Alberto !) makes you feel home

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nance30
Reviews.Content: We were given an apartment when we stayed in the hotel in March 2011 rather than the double we had booked. It was spacious and excellent in every way. There was no extra charge. The breakfast in the morning however is very small and I would therefore recommend going out for breakfast. The hotel is well situated for sights and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Room size & location good, but not upscale”
Reviews.Author: traveller4245
Reviews.Content: The Lombardy is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan. It's within walking distance to central park, times square, and shops on 5th avenue. The room we had was large (compared to other rooms I've rented in New York for similar prices) & came equipped with a tiny kitchenette and free wi-fi. Room decor and bedding was very basic; motel-style, no frills. Carpet and bathroom walls were in need of some TLC. Note: we had the room with the mirrored hallway that's mentioned in other reviews. Pros: Convenient location, large room w/ kitchenette, freebies (breakfast, bottled water, wi-fi), friendly staff Cons: Outdated room, kitchenette w/ coffee maker (but coffee not provided), must request for water bottles The hotel is appropriately rated as a 3-star establishment. I would stay here again, but would specifically request an updated room, in order to have the luxury boutique hotel experience that they advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gutsygirltravels
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Lombardy hotel located in midtown Manhattan. The location is ideal for both tourists and business travelers, with a subway station two blocks away and within easy walking distance of major shopping and restaurant destinations. The only negative was the continental breakfast which is included in the room rate. The breakfast room is a converted dark and dingy bar and the selection of morning offerings was limited to two loaves of bread, some anemic and unappetizing grocery store pastries and a coffee urn that supplied weak, lukewarm coffee. Yuck! If management improves on their breakfast, they will greatly improve their standing when compared to similar European-style boutique hotel properties in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: LeAnne D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and we say it's an average hotel. We arrived to the hotel and the Lobby was welcoming but small. Our room was great but the next morning we went down for breakfast and there was nothing but a few pastries, so we did not continue having breakfast in the hotel. I do not recommend the hotel for family and kids but I do for business trips. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gofish2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/1-12/3 with two friends for girls getaway. Room we booked was large and had two queens, which is a giant plus in NYC. This is a residential building, so it is not the same feel as a regular hotel. The lobby is small, but lovely. From what I can gather, the rooms vary greatly depending on the owner of the unit. This room was in serious need of updating--the heating system was awful. It was the old push button vent, and it was broken. There was a small kitchenette which was convenient. Bathroom had no vent for the steam and super small. Very, very clean though! Not sure I would stay again, but the room met our needs. The location is terrific! E56th between Park and Lex. Tons of shopping around and close to Central Park. If you need two queens and some space, this is it, but don't expect to be wow-ed.

Reviews.Title: “The Lombardy”
Reviews.Author: Brie_87
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and friendly. Room was basic and very small. It was literally like a small bedroom in an old house and was a little creepy at night with the noises of the building. The view was of a dingy back alley. However the bed was comfortable, continental breakfast was good, and the location was convenient for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “The best possibel”
Reviews.Author: Beto11
Reviews.Content: Incredible location and very confortable rooms. It is really all you need in the heart of manhattan. The only thing they could improve is the breakfast. Particularlly

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel that feels more like a condo than a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: russr
Reviews.Content: A very large suite - large living room/dining room, full kitchen, big bedroom, 2 bathrooms - all in a wonderful location. I booked 2 months in advance and for just over $300 a night, we were very satisfied with our accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. Just like home but in Manhatten.”
Reviews.Author: Ganor
Reviews.Content: The best place we've stayed in Manhattan so far. If you can skip a large Foyer or impressive in-house restaurants (or other "Full Hotel Services") and prefer to feel at home this is a great place. Large, updated, tastefully furnished apartments, comfortable beds. Our room smelled like home rather than hotel. Efficient elevators, friendly staff and great location. Ask for room 1600 for good value and 1504 to spoil (the whole family). We shall certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good option on the east side”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: The Lombardy is an older hotel well located on E. 56th St between Park and Lex. My room was spacious by NYC standards and included a small efficiency kitchen. The bed was firm and comfortable. It's an older property and the furniture is a bit dated (although there was a large flat panel TV), but in good repair. All in all, a convenient location and comfortable room. The continental breakfast is a joke. They'd be better off without it as offering such meager fare is almost insulting. There was bread, a toaster, some pastries, sour apples and coffee. No cereal, no bagels, no yoghurt, forget about sliced fruit or eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room 303!”
Reviews.Author: BiCoastal_11
Reviews.Content: I'm in New York frequently for business. This was by far the best hotel experience I've had. The suite I stayed in was so tastefully decorated, had great amenities and was amazingly priced. You can't beat the location and the service is top notch. I was surprised by the beautiful modern kitchen, which had everything you need for a stay in New York, even an ice maker. I loved the "rain shower" shower head in the stunning renovated bathroom -- actually I discovered that the whole suite had recently been completely redone. There are lovely city views with trees out all the windows; the room is so quiet I forgot I was in New York The staff was extremely accommodating, I was originally put in another room and asked if they had anything nicer, they moved me to 303 and I couldn't believe the difference! The secret to the Lombardy is knowing which room to stay in. I found out that each room is individually owned. The owners of 303 have impeccable taste in art (originals on the walls) and design. The bed was so comfortable, I felt like I was at home. The suite has huge flat screen televisions in both rooms with free HBO, streaming NETFLIX and tons of cable channels. This hotel suite was like being a guest in a friend's fabulous Park Avenue apartment. I plan to book room 303 for my next trip to New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round midddle range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thoughtful100
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Upper Midtown attractions and Central Park. Good quality room, spacious and well-appointed. Good kitchenette, but no complimentary coffee/milk/sugar etc, so we couldn't have a drink on arrival and had to buy from shop - maybe this is normal for NY, but this was our first visit. Excellent service (doorman, concierge, bell boy etc). Simple continental breakfast included. No restaurant, lounge or even a decent bar (just a small bar where breakfast was served), but who needs these when Manahattan is on your doorstep. Good value-for money. Our room was at the back so no noise except the slightly irritating air conditioning of the blocks behind us.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable hotel, very good location with breakfast included in rate”
Reviews.Author: TuristfromBrazil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on vacations in August 2010, following a friends advice we booked at the Lombardy which is a hotel where you get to stay in a flat. The decoration , furniture follows the ownerÂ´s taste .The flat we stayed had a huge terrace , the living room was very confortable with comtemporary decoration, dinner table where we had our breakfast, free internet acces .Continental Breakfast is included in the daily rate which is very rare to find in NY. We had a king size bed and wal in closet. The staff was nice and helpful and kept our bags while we flew to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kayjay64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel in June during a heat wave and it was so nice to come home too each day after walking around this amazing city Very rarely has this happened to us but when checking in we were informed that they had very kindly upgraded us to a suite, which was fantastic. We like space when staying in a place for more that a few days, and so upon reading many reviews about the Lombardy which all sounded really good , and looking at pictures of various rooms that looked really spacious, we decided to stay there , and were not let down one bit . The very large bed was comfortable the bedroom enormous by New York standards. The kitchenette really good, kettle, microwave, frig, coffee maker etc. we also had the benefit of a huge sitting room with TV's in each room it's a shame that we didn't have time to use all these amenities. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, good location”
Reviews.Author: juliesf80
Reviews.Content: Nice and spacious room .Not nice view. Overall clean. Very poor breakfast. Old lobby. Good location. Good service. Poor wifi signal

Reviews.Title: “Best suite value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelhappyNy
Reviews.Content: Spacious, well decorated rooms - apartments, actually - designed by owners, in this co-op hotel. Tiny bathroom, but small downside to otherwise terrific rooms. All are different, so push for one you like. Free continental breakfast - great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok”
Reviews.Author: rmui00
Reviews.Content: Got a free upgrade to a suite which was very nice. My co-workers room was average size. A decor is a bit old and dark. Staff seemed nice during check in. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, roomy, nice and clean suit”
Reviews.Author: Yairg
Reviews.Content: I randomly got to this hotel and was very pleasantly surprised. In my previous visit I stayed in the Sofitel and the one before in the Waldorf Astoria. The room at the Lombardy is a lot better than both hotels. The other hotels have restaurants and some services that the Lombardy misses, but it's Manhattan, I don't really need a restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In this time it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: carlosfidelis
Reviews.Content: I was in Lombardy from April 13 to April 22. In this time the hotel was perfect. All the staff is very friendly, helpful and I didnt have any trouble like the stay in September that I described here.

Reviews.Title: “Huge value in a quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlb32
Reviews.Content: Condo/Hotel where the owners' rooms/aprartments are rented when they are not there. Huge rooms for the City, expecially the suites which are fabulous apartments with balconies. Quietest hotel I have ever been in in New York. Faced the rear and never heard a siren all week.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: wksd
Reviews.Content: Very well kept property with a convenient, quiet location. Close to the subway, but definitely within walking distance of the heart of the city. Would definitely stay at this property again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed...this time”
Reviews.Author: Chuckus1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many rooms at the Lombardy and I am still a fan, but I was disspointed in the studio I stayed in this last time. The bathroom door paint was mostly chipped off and the wood was all decayed at the bottom of the bathroom sink. Additionally, the a/c, though funcioning looked really beaten up and about to fall apart. I think a lot of it has to do with the individual owners, but the hotel needs to do a better job enforcing making sure the rooms are decent. However, the space to price to location ratio is still hard (if not impossible to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Large, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Wearywriter
Reviews.Content: The Lombardy is a charming hotel with a lot of personality in a great location in Midtown (no view, though). It's in a perfect location for shopping. The room was surprisingly large for NYC and very clean. There was even a mini-fridge and microwave, and plenty of closet space. The hotel staff was polite and helpful when needed. The room had wired internet which worked well, although wireless would have been preferable. The room offered a great night's sleep -- this was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I expected, one of the best values in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: nymiamiguy
Reviews.Content: Booked a room before the recent snow storm last minute, got a suite with AAA rate for $285/night. When i got there the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. This is a "residential" hotel where there are several rooms that are like apartments and has all the old NY charm including an elevator operator. When I got to my room to my surprise it was a 2 bedroom apartment with kitchenette, large living room and beautiful bathroom. Turns out a famous actor had owned the apartment and recently sold it. All in this is one of the best bangs for your buck in a VERY pricey city. (oh and it was on the list of bedbug free hotels so that was a major plus). Beds were very comfy and flat screen TVs in all rooms were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blazin_blasian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lombardy for one night, very nice place for the price. Reasonable $250 in NY on the upper East side. They upgraded me to a suite, which ended up being a huge living room complete with an entire wall of books, wrap around couch and an little kitchenette. And after multiple hotels that charge for internet, it was a welcome amenity to get it for free. The shower pressure was amazing, the bed was comfortable and the people at the front desk were really nice. I would definitely stay there again. It was...homey. Might have been apartments back in the day. I will say that it's not a 'modern' luxury hotel. Nothing is granite tabletop or extra clean lines or anything like that, but it feels like you're going to a home away from home which is nice. Only downside which is why it gets a 4 and not a 5, the "continental breakfast' they advertise is horrible. it's toast, donuts and pastries in a darkly lit bar area. I'd skip it. It's almost depressing! Other than that, I was pleasantly surprised :)

Reviews.Title: “First time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: anthouse
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I somehow decided on the The Lombardy, mainly because it offered a small kitchenette area. I must admit as my trip date got closer I was concerned that I had made the right decision after reading some adverse comments on this hotel. I was traveling with my adult daughter and from the moment we checked in we were blown away with the size of the room (room 701). After 7 nights in this hotel we travelled up to Niagara falls for one night & then returned to NY & stayed for one night at a more expensive & higher rated hotel & this room size would have been less that quarter of the size of The Lombardy. All staff at The Lombardy were incredibly friendly & helpful. Breakfast was sparse but adequate, rooms incredibly clean and tidy. Location of hotel was incredibly central for upper east side. You do have to realize if you are a tourist in NYC to get to theatre and Time Square area is possible by long walk or cab ride away (if you are lucky enough to get a cab), I definitely will be back to NYC - seeing as this trip was a "shop till you drop" holiday with my daughter, need to come back with my husband and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CoriSB
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I visited NYC for a short city break during the beginning of December. It was my first time in the city and the Lombardy was a fantastic place to stay to get a taste of some of NYC's greatest attractions and shopping. It was conveniently located at East 56th Street (between Park and Lexington Avenueâ€™s) and a close walk to 5th Avenue and Central Park. I believe most of the rooms in the hotel are apartments owned privately as additional residences to people who live out of town/overseas and are rented out throughout the year so many are decorated differently according to the taste of the owners. We had a beautiful, comfortable and clean room with a small kitchen but took in the local restaurants for our meals. The hotel staffs were friendly, professional and helpful. I recall the shower pressure was a bit crazy but nothing to complain about. The only con of the experience was waiting a half hour to get our car back from the valet parking after check out; however, I would advise against driving your car to NYC and take the train / plane as we didn't use it the entire time we were there and parking can be pricey. Overall, a great hotel and experience! We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service I've ever experienced at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: uconn_cappy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for one night with some of my oldest and dearest friends for a "girls" getaway. I'll start with the pros since there were so few: the rooms were clean, the location was good/quiet, and the bellhops were friendly. For $700/night, you would expect to be treated well, but we were treated like trash by desk staff at check-in and check-out. Desk staff had quoted a room rate, including tax, when a friend called to confirm our reservation and the morning of check-in when we dropped off our luggage. When we went to check-in later that afternoon, they told us their desk staff was wrong and we owed $100 more for the room. Upon check-out we were incorrectly charged a $70 fee by the desk staff (unlike the room rate, this issue was eventually resolved). Both the check-in and check-out experience were degrading and took more than an hour out of our 30 hour trip to NYC. We had reserved a room with 2 queen beds, which was reiterated to us at check-out by desk staff - but no luck! The room only had 2 full sized beds. Housekeeping was a problem too. At 6:30 at night we called down and asked for extra towels that never arrived so we had to share hair towels with each other. When we came back from dinner at 11:00 we had to ask for towels again, but when they arrived there were no washcloths so we had to remove our makeup with hand towels. On the morning of check-out we had stepped out for less than a half hour; when we returned to the room the housekeeper was there. We explained that we would be checking out within a half hour and she could continue later but it took a while to get her out of the room and she seemed confused about whether or not to strip the beds. Since we were checking out it seems like stripping the beds would be an obvious choice. They offered a continental breakfast with the room, but it was pretty low quality. Worse, just minutes after we sat down to eat our muffins we were being rushed out of the breakfast room because they had to "close it." I would recommend spending your money elsewhere. My friend communicated to the desk staff that she stays at the Lombardy frequently for work; if this is how they treat repeat and frequent customers I donâ€™t have much confidence in their customer service abilities.

Reviews.Title: “a great location but I had some problems...”
Reviews.Author: carlosfidelis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Lombardy from 31 august to 09 Sepetember in the room 1607. The location is great, close to everything like metro stations and shops and the price is not the cheapest one but its good..and a simple but honest breakfast is included in the price. The room is confortable and clean.. But in the second night, september 2,my air conditioning stopped working during the night and NY was reaaly hot during those days..In the morning when i went down for breakfast I asked for repairing it at 10 AM. After some shopping I came back at 12 PM and asked the same guy if anyone took a look at the AC..I went up to leave the bags and the air conditioning was broken yet. Leaving the bags and going out again i just remembered THE SAME GUY about the airconditioning.............. At 10-30 PM after the theater, i came into my room and,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,SURPRISE...nothing happened wit airconditioning and i was going to have the second night with out the AC with a very hot season...and after 3 times asking for repairing... I took the telephone and after a quick talking with the front desk the engineer was in my door...He took a look and decided thta it had to be changed, all the machine. I said for giving up cause it was 11 PM and I was really tired and I could sleep with the window a little bit opened to have fresh air... In the next morning, another staff in the front desk and when i was leaving i said that the AC could be changed. Arriving at 1PM a a noisy and portable AC was installed in my apartment. And i had this AC until the end of my stay. September 9,at 11 Am, closing bags to check out the hotel I got into the shower box to have my last refreshing moment in NY... WATER??? NO WATER in the bathroom! After a quick talking on the telephone I said that ALL the hotel was without water and there was no prediction about it. Very angry I tried to have some more time in the room until the water be repaired but the guy from front desk said he was not able to allowe me. With all my luggage in the front desk, paying the stay the water engineer said that tha water was repaired and the guy from fromtdesk permitted me to come back and have a shower. After 30 minutes in the room having a shower I was really going away from THE LOMBARDY .. Bad maintenance? Coincidences?

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel find in NYC - huge clean suite, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night business trip to NYC with two colleagues - we were going to be working at 3rd and 58th so I looked on line for a hotel nearby, and found The Lombardy on 56th at Lexington - it had great reviews so we booked in there - FABULOUS! I had a one bedroom apartment, not just a room, it was great, I only wish I had been staying longer to be able to take advantage of the spacious living room and fully equipped kitchen...the bathroom was great, the bed was sooooooo comfortable - there was an LCD tv in the bedroom and the livingroom - there was a safe in the walk in closet, always good to have on a trip. The AC worked well, everything was clean - the staff were terrific and allowed us to keep all of our luggage in one of the rooms for a late check out at 3pm (instead of noon) - then, they allowed us to leave our luggage in a locked room in the lobby, as we were still working and needed to leave for the airport about 5pm - they arranged a car to take us to the airport in Newark too - I didn't think it was possible to find a spacious clean room in NYC in a great area, within walking distance of everything, in July for an affordable rate - $251.93 a night! Everyone complains about the size of NYC hotel rooms, if you want space, check in at The Lombardy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room, friendly staff - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: k_cavanagh_99
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 6 nights at the Lombardy in January 2010. We loved every minute of it, and we were pleasantly surprised at the standard of the hotel. The room was more like a suite, with much more space than we're used to from similar standard UK hotels. The location was great for exploring Manhattan and all in all, even though we didn't spend much time in the hotel, having a nice room to come back to at night made the trip extra special. We would definitely return and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lionelhutz
Reviews.Content: The Lombardy is a nice hotel in a great midtown location. Standard room is a good size and the stay was enjoyable. But there were little downsides. Some of the furniture, like chairs, looked as though they were purchased 25 years ago. Standup shower was huge but the door was heavy and groaned loudly every time it was opened. Bathroom was a little cramped and the toilet was positioned in the small corner behind the door, almost as if they forgot to install it. There was a closet that contained some travel and fiction books for the guest. But opening the other side of the closet, the shelves were full of hardware like screwdrivers and paint. Nice little fridge but no mini-bar (if you are looking for it).

Reviews.Title: “Authentic New York Hotel- Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: katycatLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for son's 18th Birthday celebrations. Rooms were individual in style, luxurious and huge with separate kitchenette. Just off a very busy street, but felt like an oasis of calm. The staff could not have been more helpful, and made our stay perfect. The location is great, near to Central Park, and it's easy to get to all the main attractions from there. (So easy that my son found his own way back when we lost him downtown on the subway! Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and will be returning for my son's 21st next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little jewel”
Reviews.Author: rwadge
Reviews.Content: What a find!! From the moment of checkin my wife and I felt totally looked after. It was not like staying in a hotel but rather a friendly apt away from home. Close to everything. Quiet. Free internet nad complimentary breakfast and umbrella when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: L_CLE
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Lombardy involves compromise. The good stuff: The location is superb. The rooms are huge by NYC hotel standard. Very quiet. Staff friendly. The not so good stuff: Our room was shabby at best. Furnished with what looked like an assortment of cast-offs from someone's attic or basement. Bathroom vanity doors hanging off hinges, tub old and scarred with antique (not in the good way) drain and stopper. Beds rock hard. The kitchenette was a bit scary and I wouldn't think of using it; the way it was furnished it certainly had no place in a Park Avenue property. For the location and size of rooms, the value is good but this is not the elegant upscale property I expected based on other reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting our expectations”
Reviews.Author: BruxellesBrel
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to 5th avenue and Central Park. We stayed there for the New Year Eve and as a base for shopping and visiting. Was very convenient. We can not complain about the room as we were unexpectedly upgraded to a suite (no room available despite early booking months before). If you like genuine American breakfast, forget about the hotel one. But it is enough for a light Continental-like breakfast. Staff was OK, a bit too stylish. All in all, this was quite a good stay and we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Special hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Nice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife after a business trip. Its a wonderful looking and positioned hotel. Breakfast, well, its there but its not much and you dont realy need it. when in NY, have breakfast outside like everybody else. Much more fun as well. The room we were given was extremely big with a all mirror hallway, a kitchenette, walk in closet, big bed en nice bathroom. but it was difficult if not impossible to turn down the heating in the bathroom. Not much of a view either but we could compensate by watching the large TV opposite the bed. It located near the south east corner of Central Par. this measn you are in the area of luxury and offices. its not the most 'fun' part of NY but evrything is easily reached anyway. The bar adjacent (were you have the breakfast served, well serf-serviced, in the morning) has a wonderful barkeeper. Let him advise you what to drink and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “big for nyc”
Reviews.Author: x-gadget-x
Reviews.Content: The Lombardy had rooms that were nicely appointed, and of the size you expect when you visit any where other than NYC. My wife and I stayed one night. We came in by train, arriving in grand central. Its walking distance to the hotel, which was nice. You can also walk to the park, or towards the shopping on 5th. Great location. Beds were comfy, good shower, and a nice TV, but who'd ever turn it on when you've got all the attractions of NYC outside? The continental breakfast was free, nothing special there. Staff was helpful, and the bar was good too. Nothing's cheap in NYC, so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickdyville
Reviews.Content: No Breakfast and Really bad restaurant BUT Great service and very nice bedroom. Very Comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fatz2fly
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again despite the few minuses. Pros: â€¢ Clean and comfortable â€¢ Spacious Room w/large flat screen TV â€¢ Kitchenette w/microwave, range & refrigerator â€¢ Great location, only three blocks from subway â€¢ Large closet â€¢ Great value for the money Cons: â€¢ Smallish bathroom in need of new wallpaper and paint â€¢ Ubiquitous New York blasÃ© attitude from staff

HotelInfo.Name: The Lombardy
HotelInfo.Address: 111 East 56th Street, New York City, NY 10022
